body: [ยง 5.1.3.](https://w3c.github.io/webauthn/#sctn-createCredential) states:  > When this method is invoked, the user agent MUST execute the following algorithm:  This means that not only are AAGUIDs "allowed" to not be zeroed out, but that it is in fact _forbidden_ to do so as that would violate the algorithm which _MUST_ be followed. Am I being too pedantic here, or are user agents in fact not allowed to zero out AAGUID?
@zacknewman I think your conclusion is accurate - clients are expected to conform to the normative algorithm definitions.
